description: TestExecution is the Schema for the testexecutions API

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: TestExecutionSpec defines the desired state of TestExecution

activeDeadlineSeconds.description:
Optional duration in seconds the pod may be active on the node relative to
StartTime before the system will actively try to mark it failed and kill associated containers.
Value must be a positive integer.

artifactRequest.description: artifact request body with test artifacts

masks.description: regexp to filter scraped artifacts, single or comma separated

omitFolderPerExecution.description: don't use a separate folder for execution artifacts

sharedBetweenPods.description: whether to share volume between pods

sidecarScraper.description: run scraper as pod sidecar container

storageClassName.description: artifact storage class name for container executor

useDefaultStorageClassName.description: whether to use default storage class name

volumeMountPath.description: artifact volume mount path for container executor

disableWebhooks.description: whether webhooks should be called on execution

mapToVariables.description: whether we shoud map to variables from resource

reference.description:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

mapToVariables.description: whether we shoud map to variables from resource

reference.description:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

envs.description:
Environment variables passed to executor.
Deprecated: use Basic Variables instead

executePostRunScriptBeforeScraping.description: execute post run script before scraping (prebuilt executor only)

executionNamespace.description: namespace for test execution (Pro edition only)

items.description:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

namespace.description: test kubernetes namespace (\"testkube\" when not set)

negativeTest.description: negative test will fail the execution if it is a success and it will succeed if it is a failure

postRunScript.description: script to run after test execution

preRunScript.description: script to run before test execution

runningContext.description: running context for test or test suite execution

context.description: Context value depending from its type

secretEnvs.description:
Execution variables passed to executor from secrets.
Deprecated: use Secret Variables instead

sourceScripts.description: run scripts using source command (container executor only)

sync.description: whether to start execution sync or async

testSuiteName.description: unique test suite name (CRD Test suite name), if it's run as a part of test suite

testSuiteSecretUUID.description: test suite secret uuid, if it's run as a part of test suite

valueFrom.description: or load it from var source

configMapKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a ConfigMap.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

optional.description: Specify whether the ConfigMap or its key must be defined

fieldRef.description:
Selects a field of the pod: supports metadata.name, metadata.namespace, `metadata.labels['<KEY>']`, `metadata.annotations['<KEY>']`,
spec.nodeName, spec.serviceAccountName, status.hostIP, status.podIP, status.podIPs.

apiVersion.description: Version of the schema the FieldPath is written in terms of, defaults to "v1".

fieldPath.description: Path of the field to select in the specified API version.

fileKeyRef.description:
FileKeyRef selects a key of the env file.
Requires the EnvFiles feature gate to be enabled.

key.description:
The key within the env file. An invalid key will prevent the pod from starting.
The keys defined within a source may consist of any printable ASCII characters except '='.
During Alpha stage of the EnvFiles feature gate, the key size is limited to 128 characters.

optional.description:
Specify whether the file or its key must be defined. If the file or key
does not exist, then the env var is not published.
If optional is set to true and the specified key does not exist,
the environment variable will not be set in the Pod's containers.

If optional is set to false and the specified key does not exist,
an error will be returned during Pod creation.

path.description:
The path within the volume from which to select the file.
Must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

volumeName.description: The name of the volume mount containing the env file.

resourceFieldRef.description:
Selects a resource of the container: only resources limits and requests
(limits.cpu, limits.memory, limits.ephemeral-storage, requests.cpu, requests.memory and requests.ephemeral-storage) are currently supported.

containerName.description: Container name: required for volumes, optional for env vars

divisor.description: Specifies the output format of the exposed resources, defaults to "1"

secretKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a secret in the pod's namespace

key.description: The key of the secret to select from.  Must be a valid secret key.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

optional.description: Specify whether the Secret or its key must be defined

variablesFile.description: variables file content - need to be in format for particular executor (e.g. postman envs file)

status.description: TestExecutionStatus defines the observed state of TestExecution

latestExecution.description:
INSERT ADDITIONAL STATUS FIELD - define observed state of cluster
Important: Run "make" to regenerate code after modifying this file

args.description: additional arguments/flags passed to executor binary

artifactRequest.description: artifact request body with test artifacts

masks.description: regexp to filter scraped artifacts, single or comma separated

omitFolderPerExecution.description: don't use a separate folder for execution artifacts

sharedBetweenPods.description: whether to share volume between pods

sidecarScraper.description: run scraper as pod sidecar container

storageClassName.description: artifact storage class name for container executor

useDefaultStorageClassName.description: whether to use default storage class name

volumeMountPath.description: artifact volume mount path for container executor

bucketName.description: minio bucket name to get uploads from

certificateSecret.description: git auth certificate secret for private repositories

path.description: if needed we can checkout particular path (dir or file) in case of BIG/mono repositories

tokenSecret.description: Testkube internal reference for secret storage in Kubernetes secrets

uri.description: uri of content file or git directory

usernameSecret.description: Testkube internal reference for secret storage in Kubernetes secrets

workingDir.description: if provided we checkout the whole repository and run test from this directory

disableWebhooks.description: whether webhooks should be called on execution

envs.description:
Environment variables passed to executor.
Deprecated: use Basic Variables instead

executePostRunScriptBeforeScraping.description: execute post run script before scraping (prebuilt executor only)

executionNamespace.description: namespace for test execution (Pro edition only)

errorMessage.description: error message when status is error, separate to output as output can be partial in case of error

isVariablesFileUploaded.description: in case the variables file is too big, it will be uploaded to storage

postRunScript.description: script to run after test execution

preRunScript.description: script to run before test execution

runningContext.description: running context for test or test suite execution

context.description: Context value depending from its type

sourceScripts.description: run scripts using source command (container executor only)

testSuiteName.description: unique test suite name (CRD Test suite name), if it's run as a part of test suite

testSuiteSecretUUID.description: test suite secret uuid, if it's run as a part of test suite

uploads.description: list of file paths that need to be copied into the test from uploads

valueFrom.description: or load it from var source
